alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:15AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following counties, western Los Angeles, San Luis Obispo, Santa Barbara and Ventura. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. Local media have reported water rescues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 AM PST, Scattered showers lingered across the region. There continued to be reports of flooding across the area. The showers are expected to increase in coverage and intensity through through the early morning hours. Scattered thunderstorms will build into the region during the morning and may continue into the afternoon. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen across the coasts and coastal valleys with 6 to 12 inches and locally over 16 inches in the foothills and mountains. Additional rainfall of up to two inches will be possible, with locally higher amounts in thunderstorms. Due to the continued threat of heavy downpours with thunderstorms, the Flood Warning may have to be extended later into the day for some areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, Camarillo, San Luis Obispo, Lompoc, Fillmore, Malibu, Pismo Beach, Ojai, Montecito, Santa Ynez, Agoura Hills, Chatsworth and Woodland Hills. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
